title: Masala Dosa
description: A crispy rice and lentil crepe stuffed with spicy potato filling.
method: Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds overnight.
Grind to a smooth batter and ferment for 8 hours.
Prepare a potato filling with spices and mash.
Spread batter on a hot griddle, add potato filling, and fold.

title: Idli
description: Soft and fluffy steamed rice and lentil cakes.
method: Soak rice and urad dal separately overnight.
Grind them into a batter and ferment for 8 hours.
Pour batter into idli molds and steam for 10-12 minutes.

title: Sambar
description: A tangy lentil-based vegetable stew flavored with tamarind and spices.
method: Cook toor dal until soft.
Prepare tamarind water and cook vegetables in it.
Add cooked dal, sambar powder, and simmer.
Temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and serve.

title: Medu Vada
method: Soak urad dal overnight and grind into a smooth batter.
Add spices and shape the batter into doughnuts.
Deep fry until golden brown.

title: Rasam
description: A tangy and spicy soup made with tamarind and tomatoes.
method: Prepare tamarind water and add chopped tomatoes.
Add rasam powder and simmer for 10 minutes.
Temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and spices.

title: Pongal
description: A comforting dish of rice and lentils flavored with ghee and pepper.
method: Cook rice and moong dal together until soft.
Temper with ghee, peppercorns, cumin, and curry leaves.
Mix and garnish with roasted cashews.

title: Upma
description: A savory breakfast dish made with semolina and vegetables.
method: Roast semolina until aromatic.
Cook vegetables and temper with spices.
Add water, mix in semolina, and cook until fluffy.

title: Bisi Bele Bath
description: A hearty dish made with rice, lentils, and a unique spice blend.
method: Cook rice and dal separately.
Prepare tamarind water and cook vegetables in it.
Add cooked rice, dal, and spice blend. Mix well.
Garnish with ghee-roasted cashews and serve.

title: Coconut Chutney
description: A classic accompaniment made with coconut, chilies, and spices.
method: Grind coconut, chilies, ginger, and tamarind into a smooth paste.
Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves. Mix well.
